title: Confirm that tapping on "News" from the main page drop-down menu will open the News component
Confirm that the News page displays as expected (see Expected Result)
Confirm that the news article index on the left is scrollable
Tapping on any news article from the index on the left will open the associated article and display it on the right pane of the page
Confirm articles that do not fully fit in the pane are scrollable
Confirm that tapping multiple articles does not crash the app
Confirm that there is a thumbnail image for each of the articles
Confirm that a MLB.com logo thumbnail image exists for those articles that have not yet completely loaded
Confirm that tapping on "Standings" from the main page drop-down menu will open the Standings component
Verify that standings exist for both the American and National Leagues
Confirm that at the top of each leagues standings, the name of the league is displayed with its logo to the left
Verify that each league is broken down into 3 divisions: East, Central, and West
Verify that the following columns exist in the standings headers for each division and are in bold type: W, L, PCT, GB, L10, STRK, vs E, vs C, vs W, Home, Road, Last Game
Verify that all 30 teams are represented in the standings and that they are listed in the correct division
Verify that division winners are denoted by "y -" to the left of the team name
Verify that the wild card winner is denoted by a "w -" to the left of the team name
Verify that there is both a "Divisional" and a "Wild Card" button
Verify that tapping the "Divisional" button will display the final division standings
Verify that tapping the "Wild Card" button will display the final wild card standings
Verify that tapping the "Divisional" and "Wild Card" buttons repeatedly does not crash the app
Tapping Preview in heading opens the game preview view
Tapping Probables in heading opens the probable pitchers view
Tapping Lineups in heading opens the game lineups view
Verify that tapping quickly between the three tabs does not break the app or leave the user on the wrong page
Verify that correct team names appear in bold on top line of game information (Away vs. Home)
Verify that correct date and time appear followed by stadium information on second line of game information
Verify that radio broadcast information appears on third line of game information (Away followed by Home)
Verify that TV station information appears on fourth line of game information
Verify Away team logo appears on left side of window
Verify Home team logo appears on right side of window
Verify team's post season record to date appears just below respective logos
Verify probable pitcher image appears - Away pitcher on left side, Home pitcher on right side
Verify pitcher's name appears on first line below their image. (Format should be "(Pitcher's Name[in color signifying link]), LHP/RHP(whichever they are)"
Verify pitcher's statistics appear on second line below their image. (Format should be "W-L, #.## ERA")
Verify pitcher's statistics should show regular season statistics for games one, two and three. (Series statistics thereafter)
Verify pitcher's statistics should show given series statistics for game four and later. (Regular season statistics until that point)
Verify short text blurb with relevant summary appears on third line below pitcher's image.
Verify that link that reads "Career Stats" appears on last line below pitcher's image.
Verify that tapping the pitchers name underneath their image brings up their player card with relevant statistics and information.
Verify that tapping the "Career Stats" link brings up pitcher's player card with relevant statistics and information.
Verify appropriate place holder image appears before pitcher's image has loaded.
Verify that correct team names appear in bold on top line of game information (Away vs. Home)
Verify that correct date and time appear followed by stadium information on second line of game information
Verify that radio broadcast information appears on third line of game information (Away followed by Home)
Verify that TV station information appears on fourth line of game information
Verify Away team logo appears on left side of window
Verify Home team logo appears on right side of window
Verify team's post season record to date appears just below respective logos
Verify main headline appears in Large type bold
Verify sub headline appears in larger font size than rest of text, but smaller than main headline
Verify article author information and affiliation appear followed by date and time of article publishing. Format should be "By (Author Name) / (Affiliation) | (DD/MM/YY) (HH:MM) (AM/PM) ET"
Article text should appear and be easily readable with first few paragraphs wrapped around article image.
Verify article image appears in line with text and is not blurry or cut off.
Verify appropriate place holder image appears before article has loaded or if user does not have connectivity.
Verify that correct team names appear in bold on top line of game information (Away vs. Home)
Verify that correct date and time appear followed by stadium information on second line of game information
Verify that radio broadcast information appears on third line of game information (Away followed by Home)
Verify that TV station information appears on fourth line of game information
Verify Away team logo appears on left side of window
Verify Home team logo appears on right side of window
Verify team's post season record to date appears just below respective logos
Verify Away team lineup appears on left side of window. Home team on right.
Top line of lineups should show table header information that reads "(Team Name)    2011 Stats      Last 5 years vs. starter"
Statistics on lineup card under 2011 stats should be: AB, HR, RBI, SB.
Statistics on lineup card under Last 5 years vs. starters should be: AB, AVG, HR, RBI.
Lineup card should have each player on their own line, lined up under Team Name. (Format should be "(Last Name), (POSITION ABBR.)
Verify player's last name and position do not overlap or run into statistics on each line.
Verify if the players name is too long for one line that text wrapping occurs correctly and does not break table.
Starting pitcher information should appear below the respective team lineups.
Verify pitcher thumbnail image appears to the outside of their statistics.
First line of pitcher information should have pitchers position followed by name and should read as "(Position) - (Pitcher's Name)"[In color denoting link]
Second line of pitcher information should read "2011 season" and appear in smaller bolded text.
Third line of pitcher information should show regular season statistics. (Should show "W-L, #.## ERA, #.## WHIP, # Ks") text should not appear in bold
Fourth line of pitcher information should read "vs. (Opponent) last 5 years" in smaller bolded text.
Fifth line of pitcher information should show statistics vs opponent in last 5 years. (Should show "W-L, #.## ERA, #.## WHIP, # Ks") text should not appear in bold.
Verify tapping player names in lineup card brings up player card with relevant statistics.
Verify tapping Pitcher name on first line of pitcher information should bring up player card with relevant statistics.
Confirm that a button exists for each playoff series (DS, LCS, and WS)
Confirm that tapping each of the buttons opens the corresponding series' games menu (DS = Division Series, LCS = League Championship Series, WS = World Series)
Tapping on the series buttons repeatedly does not crash the application
Confirm that the correct number of matchups is shown under each series view (see Expected Result)
custom_expected:
DS = 4 matchups (2 ALDS / 2 NLDS)
LCS = 2 matchups (1 ALDS / 1 NLDS)
WS = 1 matchup (1 American League Team / 1 National League Team)

title: Confirm that the correct team matchups are showing up in each of the series views
Confirm that the series menu is scrollable where applicable (e.g. the DS will have 4 matchups in which scrolling down will be required to view additional menu items)
Confirm that there is a header for each series (see highlighted are in attached screenshot)
Confirm that the header for each series is formatted as expected (see attached screenshot)
Confirm that both teams' logos are displayed in the header
Confirm that the team with series home field advantage's logo is on the right
Confirm that the correct series type is referenced at the top center position of the header (e.g. ALDS, NLDS, NLCS, ALCS, WS)
Confirm that the team names are below the series type in the header (e.g. Away vs. Home)
Confirm that the team with series home field advantage's name is on the right
Confirm that below the team names, the series standing is present (please see expected result for format example)
Confirm that a menu item exists for each game in the series according to series type (see Expected Result)
custom_steps:
DS = 5 games
LCS = 7 games
WS = 7 games

title: Confirm that menu item for each game is formatted as expected (see attached screenshot)
Confirm that the games are labeled by number and are listed in numerical order
Confirm that there is an asterisk next to the game number to denote any "*If Necessary" games where applicable. The asterisk will disappear as the games become necessary (see preconditions)
custom_preconds: Applies to any games not yet required to be played (games 4(Division Series Only), 5,6, or 7)

title: Confirm that the teams names are stacked to the right of the game number with the road team on top and the home team on the bottom
Confirm that the game score is present to the right of the stacked team names (for in progress or completed games only)
Confirm that the game state exists to the right of the score (see Expected Result)
custom_expected:
-Completed Games will display "Final" to the right of the score
-In-progress games will display base markers with any occupied bases highlighted in gold along with the count and number of outs to the right of the score
-Unplayed games will list the day, date, time and TV broadcast information to the right of the score

title: Confirm game date and time with schedule on MLB.com
Confirm that each of the games is tappable
Confirm that tapping on a game will open the appropriate views to the right according to game state  (see Expected Result)
custom_expected:
"Final" game state will open the Postgame View
In-progress games will open Gameday
"Warmup" game state will open the Preview view
Future games will open the Preview View

title: Tapping on different games does not crash the application
Confirm that the "*If Necessary" text label exists at the bottom of the games menu
Verify when tapping on a game that has gone final, the user is brought to the postgame view for the correct game.
Verify Scoreboard remains in left navigation when user brings up postgame view of game
Verify game wrap page appears in center window.
Verify Right Navigation contains tabs for "Box" "Plays" "Video" and "Field"
Verify game wrap-up image appears in top half of center window above game wrap headline
Verify appropriate thumbnail appears if no image is available or if image has not yet loaded for game wrap page
Verify main headline appears in large bold text on first line below game wrap image.
Verify game result appears on second line below game wrap image. Format should be "[Series] game [x]: [Wining team] [score] [Losing team] [score]"
Verify pitching results should appear on third line below game wrap image. Should include, WP, LP and S if applicable.
Verify pitcher's record and number of saves appear following their names (ie Sabathia (2-0))

Verify players who hit home runs appear on the fourth line below game wrap image. Should include number of home runs hit as well as number in the series. Format should be "[TEAM ABBR]: [LastName] (x)"
Verify if multiple players hit home runs, their names are separated by a comma on the game wrap page.
Verify players names in the pitching and home run results appear in linked color
Verify players names in the pitching and home run results link to player cards with relevant statistics when tapped.
Verify short game summary blurb appears below pitching and home runs on game wrap page. Text should be easily readable and wrap within the window correctly.
Verify at bottom of game wrap page links to Recap pages for each team appear. Text on these links should be in color that clearly shows they are links.
Verify tapping on a recap link brings the user to the team's recap page for that specific game.
Verify Scoreboard appears in left navigation when user brings up the recap view of game
Verify recap page appears in the center window.
Verify right navigation contains tabs for "Box", "Plays" and "Video
Verify recap image appears in top half of center window above game recap headline.
Verify appropriate thumbnail appears if no image is available or if image not yet loaded for game recap page.
Verify link back to "Game Wrap" appears at top of article below recap image.
Verify "Game Wrap" link appears in text color that clearly indicates it is a link.
Verify tapping on the "Game Wrap" link takes the user back to the Game Wrap view.
Tap back to "Game Wrap" link to return to game wrap page then select the recap link for the other team. Verify the correct recap article loads.
Verify main headline appears in large bold text below recap image.
Verify sub headline appears directly below main headline in smaller bold text.
Verify article author information and affiliation appear followed by date and time of article publishing. Format should be "By (Author Name) / (Affiliation) | (DD/MM/YY) (HH:MM) (AM/PM) ET"
Verify article text appears below article header information in text that is clear and readable.
Verify text wraps correctly and does not overflow into other parts of the app or get cut off.
Tapping the Box tab should open the box score page in the right bar.
Verify user can toggle between innings in the linescore when game is extended beyond 9 innings

On the first line of the box score page, the one line summary for the game should appear. Format should be "[Series] game [x]: [Winning Team] [score] [Losing team] [score], Final[extra innings if applicable]"
Under the one line summary, the linescore for the game should appear.
Verify that the linescore is aligned properly and does not appear visibly distorted in any way.
Verify the team box score appears under the linescore and one line summary.
Verify user is able to toggle between home and away lineups
Verify the player names are selectable and open corresponding player cards when tapped
Verify players names appear highlighted signifying they are links.
Verify tapping the "Plays" tab opens the Plays window in the right bar.
Verify tapping the "Videos" tab opens the video highlights tab in the right bar.
Tapping the Plays tab should open the plays window in the right bar.
Verify the user is able to toggle between all plays and just scoring plays by tapping the corresponding button at the top of the Plays window
Verify plays are separated by half inning
Verify each play appears in sequential order within half inning. (Should have # at begining of line.)
Verify scoring plays appear in bold.
Verify while plays are visible within the half inning separation bar, the triangle on the right of the bar faces up.
Verify tapping on the half inning separation bar while it is expanded, collapses all the plays in that half inning to invisible.
Verify when the half inning separation bar collapses, the triangle on right side flips from facing up to down.
Verify tapping on the half inning separation bar while it is collapsed, expands and reveals all the plays in that half inning.
Verify when the half inning separation bar expands, the triangle on the right side flips from facing down to up.
Tapping the Video tab should open the video page in the right bar.
Verify video thumbnails appear for each video.
Verify appropriate placeholder thumbnail appears when no image is available or has not yet loaded
Condensed games (when applicable) always appear at the top of the list
Video quality should adjust while roaming across networks
Verify that video description appears in bold text, is readable and fits in module
Video should pause another apps audio when it begins to play
Video should pause At Bat apps audio when it begins to play
Watch a video when a phone/Text message/alarm is received, verify appropriate behavior.
When no video highlights are available "unable to load data" in prod; in qa its just a blank page
Verify length of video appears in red text, below headline.
Verify date and time video was posted appears next to length, in format "[Mon.] [Day.], [TT:TT][AM/PM], EDT"
Tapping the "Box" tab should open the Box score window in the right bar.
Tapping the "Plays" tab should open the Play window in the right bar.
Verify tapping the headphones button in the top nav opens up a list of available gameday audio streams.
Verify that tapping on a listed matchup brings up the available feeds for that game.
Verify tapping on a feed button begins streaming that audio for the selected feed.
Verify when a stream begins to connect, the volume slider and Switch Audio feed button appear in the player.
Verify selecting a station different than that which is currently playing begins playing the stream for the new station.
custom_steps: Select a station button different from that which is already playing
custom_expected: Feed will switch to the station selected

title: Verify when a stream begins playing, the button for that feed appears pressed and darker
Verify if  the user stops a stream the stop button turns into a play button and the stream stops
Verify if a stream stops on its own, the stop button turns into a play button
Verify when the user presses the Stop button the volume slider and Switch Audio Feed button disappears.
Verify when a stream stops, the volume slider and Switch Audio Feed button disappears.
Verify audio can be played over Wifi
Verify audio can be played over carrier network
Check all audio streams play (and pause) audio streams for the selected game. Try switching between home/away, English/Spanish feeds
Verify if gameday audio is playing and the user goes to play song or video from the native player that gameday audio stops playing and the newly selected audio plays.
Verify while audio is playing, a user is able to navigate throughout the app
Verify tapping the Stop button stops the audio for the stream that is playing.
custom_steps: Tap stop icon in audio controller
custom_expected: Audio stops playing and status reads "Stopped"

title: Verify that after the user has stopped the stream, tapping on a feed button starts playing the desired stream.
custom_expected: Audio feed stars and status reads "NOW PLAYING"

title: Verify when a user has selected a matchup, the game appears highlighted in the list of feeds.
Verify having 1 to 4 streams available works as expected. Buttons should resize and work regardless of how many feeds are available.
Verify tapping the matchup in the list for the game currently selected does not restart the audio for the selected stream.
Verify selecting a depressed button does not restart the audio stream which should already be playing.
custom_steps: Select the already-depressed button for the currently playing-feed
custom_expected: Button will not do anything (no action should happen)

title: Audio Streaming Tests
Check that feeds are only available when the media_state=MEDIA_ON and game is not final in mobile_epg.xml. Check both the team page and scoreboard.
Play audio on all carriers (AT&T, Verizon)
Play audio on all networks (wi-fi, 3G, edge)
Play audio on all OSes
custom_preconds: If devices are not available with specific OS's use emulator.

title: Verify that notification area displays ongoing notification while audio is playing. This should display "away_team @ home_team - station_team (station_name)"
Play audio while roaming between wifi and carrier. Audio should continue to play
Verify moving the volume slider adjusts audio for a stream that is playing.
Verify tapping the Switch Audio Feed button restarts the audio with the different feed.
Verify when the user taps the Switch Audio Feed button the name of the feed changes in the text to the left of the button to match which feed will be selected when the user taps the button.
Verify using the audio slider on the device adjusts audio for the stream that is playing.
Verify changing the audio using the buttons on the device is reflected in the audio slider in the audio UI.
